disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

extracted_data_phrases: by refusing their guidance on matters that concerned them
disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents by refusing their guidance on matters that concerned them?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: When frustrated with Church members, did I reject their unity?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

extracted_data_phrases: for spiritual reflection , such as Ash Wednesday
disobedience.question: Did I skip any days that are obligatory for spiritual reflection, such as Ash Wednesday?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did you use your words to belittle or mock the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

extracted_data_phrases: from receiving Sacraments or attending Mass
condoning.question: Did I, through my words, lead other Catholics to stay away from receiving Sacraments or attending Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Have I, through my words, led other Catholics to neglect their Sacraments or Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.description: As part of the corporal works of mercy, we're called to be merciful and compassionate to those in distress.

extracted_data_phrases: for human validation , comfort , and acceptance

condoning.description: Prioritizing human approval over standing firm in God's truth demonstrates both moral cowardice and places human opinion above divine authority.

extracted_data_phrases: on the dignity of the human body

condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

extracted_data_phrases: particularly through their relationships , activities , or interactions with peers

condoning.question: Did I give my approval to another Catholic for marrying outside the Church, potentially leading them away from the sacraments?

extracted_data_phrases: by remaining silent or failing to speak out against it

uncharity.question: Have I spoken badly about others, disrespecting their dignity as children of God?

uncharity.question: Have I not neglected to assist those in need when they sought my help?

extracted_data_phrases: from someone who was suffering illness

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially during social gatherings or celebrations?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
into excessive desires that disordered your relationship with yourself
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, giving into excessive desires that disordered your relationship with yourself?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.question: Have I let my financial obligations, particularly those that support family needs, take precedence over excessive and wasteful gambling?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: over meeting my financial responsibilities and family needs
prodigality.question: Have I recklessly prioritized my own recreational spending over meeting my financial responsibilities and family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing private conversations, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in sharing others ' private concerns through conversations
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private concerns through conversations, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in unnecessary work that detracted from my rest on Sunday
impiety.question: Did I engage in unnecessary work that detracted from my rest on Sunday, contrary to the Church's teaching?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: on a Sunday when it otherwise could be avoided , thereby offending God
impiety.question: Did I schedule work on a Sunday when it otherwise could be avoided, thereby offending God?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
